clinical_study.brief_title: Emergency Department MCG for Suspected Acute Coronary Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Emergency Department MCG for Suspected Acute Coronary Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to assess a new non-invasive computerized, multiphase, resting electrocardiogram analysis device in early identification of patients at risk for acute coronary syndrome. The overall objective is to assess the association between the results from a resting MCG and 30-day cardiovascular outcome in patients presenting to the emergency department with suspected coronary disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of MCG as assessed by the development of major adverse cardiac events (MACE).
primary_outcome.description: MACE will be defined as the composite of cardiac death, myocardial infarction (MI), or coronary revascularization. 2.2 Seco11dary

arm_group.description: non-invasive computerized, multiphase, resting electrocardiogram analysis device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 and over.
- Symptoms consistent with a possible acute coronary syndrome per the treating emergency physician.
- Has an electrocardiogram performed while in the ED.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute ST-segment elevation MI.
- Patient unable or unwilling to complete follow-up.
